Title: Process Engineer, Municipal Drinking Water - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Contract type
Regular / Permanent
WHO WE ARE
SUEZ Water Technologies & Solutions looks for innovation everywhere. For more than 100 years, SUEZ has been at the forefront of innovation, from the SUEZ Canal to addressing water scarcity. Finding solutions to the world's biggest problems has never been more important than right now.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Process Engineers on the Municipal Process Engineering team are key partners in providing clean, safe, drinking water for communities in need. They are creative technical leaders responsible for supporting the successful sale, execution, and operation of complete system solutions for the treatment of water in the North American market. To win new opportunities, they apply deep technical knowledge of our solutions and technologies combined with an understanding of the market and our competitors to continually balance technical risk with commercial viability. They also build long term relationships with our customers and key experts in the industry and share technical expertise in industry forums to position SUEZ Water Technologies & Solutions (WTS) as experts within the market.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
In addition to a desire and ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, work collaboratively with interdisciplinary teams, and work independently to meet deadlines with minimal oversight, we are looking for someone with:
Core Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical/Mechanical/Environmental Engineering or related technical discipline.
Experience with municipal water processes and system design/operation – especially in ultrafiltration and/or reverse osmosis membrane design.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant or related experience, preferably 10 years or more.
Useful skills or abilities:
Excellent computer skills (i.e., Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
Willingness to periodically travel within North America.
French language skills may be useful, but not required.
To protect our customers, our employees, and their families, we strongly encourage, and in some cases will require, successful new hires to be vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment unless an exemption is granted. Help us protect each other by protecting yourself.
Compensation
: Period 0.00 - 0.00 CAD
Is relocation for this position offered
: No
Number of Job Openings
: 1
Company Grade/Band
:
Water Technologies and Solutions (WTS) offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation.
WTS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Process Engineer - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What we offer?
Are you curious? Come challenge yourself, innovate and learn in your everyday work - supported by an exceptionally talented Team. Join our journey. Mobility is changing - and Veoneer is a part of driving this change towards safe mobility solutions.
You will have access to exciting and emerging technologies. We focus on your professional and technical growth within advanced driving assistance systems (ADAS), collaborative and autonomous driving. We empower our teams to move technology forward in this fast-paced and challenging industry.
Are you ready to contribute to this change? Veoneer has around 9,000 purpose-driven employees in 13 countries around the world. Come join Veoneer as we lead the way in Creating Trust in Mobility.
What you'll do?
Act as a process lead for one or more assembly lines with responsibility for equipment performance/efficiency.
Investigate and implement controls and mechanical continuous improvement actions to improve process performance, quality and safety.
Investigate and resolve internal and external quality issues using various problem-solving methods.
Interface with Design Engineering, Quality, Logistics, Test Engineering and Surface Mount Technology (SMT) engineering departments.
What you'll bring?
Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Degree.
1-3 years of experience in manufacturing.
Experience with Poke Yokes, Process Failure Mode Effects Analysis (PFMEA), Machinery Failure Mode Effects Analysis (MFMEA), and Statistical Analysis.
Strong project management, interpersonal, written and verbal communications skills.
Automated Assembly Systems experience, including Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) and PC Controls programming.
Mechanical design experience using Solidworks or AutoCAD is preferred.
Experience with OMRON, Beckhoff and/or Visual Basic would be an asset.
A candidate who possesses an electronics manufacturing background would be an asset.
We thank all applicants for their interest. Veoneer is an equal opportunity employer and
is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations may be made available upon request from candidates throughout the hiring process.

Title: Civil Engineer - Whitehorse, YT - Indeed.com
Description:
Morrison Hershfield is a multi-disciplinary consulting engineering and management firm located throughout the US and Canada. We are a dynamic, employee-owned, team-oriented firm with a diverse project list that ensures you will be working on exciting, high-profile and challenging projects. For more than 75 years, the people at Morrison Hershfield have been the leading force behind our continuous growth and the expansion of our services.
Morrison Hershfield's goal is to ensure the development of safe, reliable and sustainable infrastructure to serve private, government, industrial and institutional organization. From concept development through to operations and management, we provide a full range of infrastructure development services. Our main area of practice in our Whitehorse office includes river engineering, renewable energy , stormwater, groundwater, potable water and wastewater. We design our projects with quality, safety, efficiency, environment stewardship with future demands in mind.
Responsibilities:
Project engineering of water resources projects including hydrologic and hydraulic modeling, design of hydraulic structures, flood management and mitigation, and erosion mitigation
Planning studies of water and wastewater systems
Design of municipal infrastructure services of water, storm and sanitary
Opportunity to participate in the preparation of complex hydrologic studies to support flood mitigation, hydropower studies river engineering studies
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering or water resource engineering related degree
P. Eng designation is an asset
Minimum 4 years of experience in a similar role
Understanding of Water Resources Engineering and related Federal, Territorial and local water management policies.
Working knowledge of various Water Resources modeling programs (. e. g. HEC-RAS, HEC-HMS) would be an asset.
Experience in the field of hydropower would be an asset.
Enjoys working with a variety of clients and has a keen interest in tailoring solutions to the local context
Focused on providing good service to internal and external clients and meeting project timelines
Values work life balance with a commitment to personal professional development
A desire to continually improve skills, innovate and actively seek out feedback
Experience working with CAD and other engineering design software
Excellent writing and communication skills
Project management of projects, including scope, schedule and budget management
Writing technical reports to assist our clients in making decisions
Preparing of detailed design and specifications for construction projects
Administering construction project, including applicable field inspections.
Meeting with clients and stakeholders to understand and execute deliverables
Project management of projects, including scope, schedule and budget management
Leading teams to execute projects, including mentoring
Assisting with proposal preparation

Title: Systems Engineer Associate - Halifax, NS - Indeed.com
Description:
Specific Job Description
Lockheed Martin Canada is Canada's most successful Combat System Integrator specializing in large sophisticated integration projects. We take advantage of advanced engineering practices and modern technologies to design, develop and integrate combat systems for naval warships. We are seeking motivated and high performing people with specific skills to become part of our dynamic Naval Programs team.
The Naval Programs team is responsible for technical planning, design, construction, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, supportability and effectiveness analysis for total systems. Involvement as part of the total system product development includes: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal. The team ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule and cost constraints.
The Naval Programs team spans across Lockheed Martin Canada's main project sites (Kanata, Montreal, Dartmouth), opportunities are available at all sites for supporting Naval Combat Systems Programs and Proposal Capture activities.
The candidate will participate as a Systems Engineering member of the Naval Development team in a multi-disciplined team environment working on the total engineering life cycle from specification, design, development, integration and test, deployment, maintenance and field trouble shooting for large scale high complexity naval platform systems.
The candidate will participate in engineering activities including but not limited to:
Working in a Model Based System Engineering (MBSE) environment to support:
Assisting in requirement management work and derivation
Performing system modelling and design, including but not limited to: physical design, logical design and behaviour modelling
Building the MBSE model in support of producing deliverables
Support system architecture and design and integration planning
Following systems engineering processes and best practices.
Employee Type
Full Time
Vacancy Type
Permanent
Business Environment
Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 110,000 people worldwide, including more than 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 80 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities. This position is part of the Rotary and Mission Systems business area, where employees across Canada support engineering, systems integration, training, sustainment and in-service support programs for Canadian and international military customers across land, air and sea.
Clearance required for role
Nato Secret
Required skills, qualifications and experience
Possess a Bachelors’ degree from an accredited university in software, hardware, systems, mechanical, electrical or electronics engineering or a related discipline.
Desired skills, qualifications and experience
0-3 years of relevant professional experience (Equivalent experience/combined education will be considered)
Experience with Software, Systems, Hardware or Maintenance engineering lifecycles
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical members of the engineering/management staff and personnel assigned to related work
Aptitude for solving challenging problems in a team environment
Have a high degree of initiative and autonomy
Have a high learning ability
Ability to adapt and perform in a dynamic environment.
Familiarity with SysML or other object-oriented design methodology
Familiarity with DOORS, Rhapsody, Clearcase, Clearquest or Windchill
Experience with Agile methods
Experience with Military Naval domainExperience with Change Management, Requirements Management, Test and Trials, Security, Safety, Electromagnetic Interference (EMI)/Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) or Environmental Qualification.
Equal Opportunity Statement
Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

Title: Mechanical Engineer Intern - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports Westinghouse’s mission to provide clean energy solutions? At Westinghouse, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.
Mechanical Engineer Intern - London, Canada
Your day to day:
You will work closely with the guidance and supervision as a team member on tasks and projects under the guidance of a Senior Engineer/Designer in both Nuclear and infrastructure (Non-Nuclear) with private clients, municipalities, healthcare, and academic establishments. Your opportunity will include;
Assist in the design of new or revised products, equipment, installations, or processes for building services (HVAC, plumbing drainage etc.), using established engineering principles to meet functional requirements or performance specifications.
Handle design problems of moderate complexity using a variety of standard engineering methods/techniques.
Perform preliminary engineering calculations, produce detailed drawings
Prepare bills of materials, specify or evaluate appropriate purchased components
Review of designs and drawings for accuracy, material selection, manufacturability.
Expand your knowledge of material properties and the behaviour of materials and structures under multiple load combinations.
Participate in key customer projects from conception to execution alongside intermediate and senior engineers. This is a terrific opportunity to support several exciting local projects.
Site visits or field work where required.
Perform field work (evaluation of existing sites) as directed by senior engineer/designer.
Participate in mechanical design including ductwork, building load calculations and equipment layouts.
Assist with engineering duties on projects of various degrees of complexity.
Productions of CAD and/or Revit drawings
Assists in handling assignments of limited scope or complexity within the mechanical department.
May modify systems applications, designs, or prototypes to permit economical manufacturing, or meet performance specifications
You you are:
Working towards a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent.
Will be required to consultative and communication abilities to confer with others (mainly internally), gather information and present analyses
Typical office environment working with computer and remaining sedentary for long periods of time
You will also have the opportunity to take part in the Westinghouse Culture and as an intern take part in specific events such as:
Virtual Kick Off Event: which is an opportunity for you to meet your peers and will feature a keynote address by a member of the Westinghouse executive leadership team.
Networking Events: During your time with Westinghouse, you will have access to numerous virtual networking and team building opportunities that will assist you in developing and cultivating superior interpersonal skills, and long-lasting relationship.
Virtual Coffee Breaks with Executives: You will have access to numerous weekly virtual coffee breaks with the Westinghouse Executives. These weekly sessions will be centered around an assortment of topics where you are encouraged to ask questions and gain insight.
Why Westinghouse?
Westinghouse Electric Company is the global nuclear energy industry’s first choice for safe, clean, and efficient energy solutions. We enable our delivery of this vision by living our value system:
Safety and Quality
Integrity and Trust
Customer Focus and Innovation
Speed and Passion to Win
Teamwork and Accountability
Westinghouse offers competitive benefits to all our employees around the globe to keep them healthy and enhance their well-being. In the U.S. the following are representative of what we offer:
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive Health, Wellness and Income Protection Benefits
401(k) Savings Plan with Company Match
Paid Vacations and Holidays
Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements
Educational Reimbursement Program
Employee Referral Program
While our Global Headquarters are located in Cranberry Township, PA, we have over 9,000 employees working at locations in 19 different countries. You can learn more by visiting http://www.westinghousenuclear.com.
EOE of Minorities / Females / Vets / Disability.

Title: Mechanical Engineer - Mississauga - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Requisition ID:
49563
Job Category:
Engineering
With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
The Mechanical & Piping Group is a Hatch global practice providing Mechanical design expertise to a wide variety of Hatch's commodity-based business practices. Our capability spans through the whole project lifecycle comprising; scoping, conceptual design, pre-feasibility, feasibility studies, detailed engineering, construction support and project management. The group supports several different fields, such as energy, mineral processing and infrastructure.
Our Mississauga team is currently seeking a dedicated Mechanical Engineer to assist project work in the office with field opportunities. The Mechanical Engineer is broadly responsible for establishing system requirements, performing functional analyses, defining design criteria, preparing engineering calculations, technical specifications, data sheets and reports. In addition, the Mechanical Engineer is required to develop, or provide input to, 3D models and 2D drawings.
As the successful candidate, you will:
Assist in defining project scope.
Assist the Project Engineering Manager/Lead Mechanical Engineer with the delivery of project requirements as they relate to scope, cost, and schedule.
Perform system analyses, establish user requirements, analyze system functional and performance requirements, define design criteria, and establish system layouts and designs.
Prepare engineering calculations such as hydraulic modeling, equipment sizing and tank, pressure vessel or bin design and ensuring that all analyses satisfy user and system requirements.
Prepare equipment technical specifications based on relevant process information and input received from other disciplines.
Prepare contract scope documents defining installation requirements.
Prepare data sheets based on input received from other disciplines.
Perform co-ordination of Vendor packages including data management.
Prepare and contribute to technical memos and reports, within areas of expertise.
Provide engineering seal, as required, to documents and drawings.
Provide input to engineering, operating and capital cost estimates.
Prepare and/or review project standard specifications and design criteria.
Prepare or provide input to 3D models and 2D mechanical drawings.
Participate in and contribute to design reviews.
Carry out assigned tasks within budget and schedule.
Assist in the compilation and delivery of monthly engineering status reports.
Assist with technical queries raised during the construction phase.
Assist in the commissioning of systems on site as required.
You bring to the role:
BSc/BEng in mechanical engineering.
Registration as a professional engineer in Ontario, or ability to transfer from another jurisdiction.
Minimum five years’ project engineering experience. EPCM experience is an asset.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Good planning and organizational skills.
Ability to function with minimal supervision.
Working knowledge of industry standards, regulations, and codes pertinent to the mechanical engineering discipline.
Ability to function as a member of a multidisciplinary team and coordinate mechanical activities between disciplines.
Demonstrated commitment to Safety in the office and Engineering Design.
Ability to delegate tasks and effectively supervise others.
Willingness to travel occasionally to other Hatch offices and project sites.
Experience in the use of procedures and workflows in the execution of projects.
We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Title: Senior Process Engineer - Sherwood Park, AB - Indeed.com
R&D Engineer - Richmond Hill, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
An exciting opportunity for
R&D Engineer
, this is a permanent opportunity with Qvella Corporation located in Richmond Hill, Ontario.
Nature and Scope of Work:
The successful candidate will work with other members of the Product Development team on the development of Qvella’s FAST suite of instruments and consumable cartridge products. This role is responsible for driving projects related to instrument design throughout all life cycle phases, and contributing in the areas of requirements definition, mechanical system development and design, 3D CAD modelling, configuration management, testing and design verification, process development and manufacturing design transfer activities.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:
Engage in testing and design verification activities.
Build and modify instrument prototypes.
Test the prototype instruments in lab environments – includes engineering bench and wet lab testing.
Must be comfortable working with electro-mechanical systems.
Debug complex systems to identify root cause of failures.
Plan and conduct design verification activities.
Develop validation plans and conduct validating testing.
Assist in Design for Manufacturing (DFM) activities.
Develop and test new manufacturing processes.
Create and review engineering documentation as required by ISO13485 processes including design requirements and specifications, risk analysis, and design output specifications.
Liaise with production and supply chain on product improvement initiatives.
Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications and Requirements:
5+ years experience in design V&V, analysis and development of instruments.
High degree of SolidWorks aptitude required.
Demonstratable technical working knowledge of thermal and small scale fluidic systems.
Working understanding of electro-mechanical systems such as pumps, valves, resistive heaters, thermoelectric heaters etc.
Strong experience in design for manufacturing, design for cost.
Must have strong excel skills to organize and process large quantities of data.
Working knowledge of ISO quality system methodology
Working familiarity with new product introduction activities including design verification, design transfer, pilot production through to general production readiness.
Must possess good communication and documentation skills.
Must possess superior problem-solving skills, strong initiative.
Education:
Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
Membership or eligibility for membership in Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) preferred and will allow for Engineer title
In support of our commitment to a healthy and safe workplace, Qvella Corporation has a vaccination requirement as a condition to the offer of employment. This includes the type of vaccine, date of each dose and sufficient identification information to connect the receipt to the candidate.

If you are a technically minded professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! Based in our Elmira, ON location, you will be responsible for supporting the design of consumer heating cables for applications such as floor warming, roof/gutter deicing, and pipe freeze protection. You will be able to see projects from inception to completion and support multiple international manufacturing sites.
AS A HEATING CABLE ENGINEER, YOU WILL:
Design components for heating cable sets and associated controls, packaging, etc.
Test heating cable designs as per internal company procedures
Work with various 3rd party certification agencies to ensure safety of designs are acceptable in the industry
Work with others to acquire 3rd party product certifications in timely manner
Provide liaison to internal departments (such as manufacturing and marketing) regarding product designs and BOM
Provide guidance to the types of tests to be conducted on a new design and input into new testing that may be required.
Propose cost savings projects and work to implement as the need arises.
Who you are:
You convert ideas into actions and produce results with new initiatives. You make new connections and build relationships in other areas and teams. You balance planning with actions. You become an early adopter. You define overall goals and objectives.
Required education, experience & skills:
Must have a diploma in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Technology or related program
At least 1 year of relevant experience in manufacturing of an electrical product
Excellent digital literacy in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams)
Excellent time management and organizational skills, as well as a strong attention to detail with high level of accuracy and a dedication to follow up.
Ability to work to deadlines and handle opposing priorities and fluctuating workloads
Strong verbal and written communication skills combined with excellent social skills to relate optimally to people both internally and externally
A collaborator and team builder that gets results
Ability to travel 15-20% to manufacturing locations in Mexico or USA and to customer sites
Preferred education, experience & skills:
Bachelor’s degree in related field from an accredited Engineering program
Knowledge of polymers/extrusion techniques and some familiarity with 3rd party certification approvals, especially UL and CSA is preferred
Familiarity with electrical and mechanical engineering, heating cable products, heat transfer, product testing, building codes for Canada and USA is preferred
WHY EMERSON?
Our Commitment to Our People
Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: We drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills, and competencies to bring this Purpose to life while competing and leading in a global economy. Our training programs focus on end-to-end development, from onboarding through senior leadership.
Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities, and the world through our unwavering focus on environmental, social, and regulatory progress. Learn more about us!
Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer you the right options to meet your individual/family needs: extended health & dental benefits, Heath Care Spending Account, life insurance coverage, registered pension plan/registered retirement savings plans. We provide employees flexible time off plans including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their experiences and perspectives – and that reflects the world around us. We believe a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.
This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Emerson is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply including women, Aboriginal Peoples, members of visible minorities and persons with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available at all stages of recruitment, selection, and employment.
If you have an accommodation need, please contact Human Resources or Accessibility.Canada@Emerson.com to make appropriate arrangements.
ABOUT EMERSON
Emerson is a leading global technology, software and engineering company providing innovative solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.
Our Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid and discrete manufacturers maximize production, protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs. Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.
We help customers in the world’s most essential industries solve the biggest challenges of modern life. Every day, our global workforce fulfills our unified Purpose and lives out the Values we hold close as an organization:
Integrity, Safety & Quality, Support Our People, Customer Focus, Continuous Improvement, Collaboration, and Innovation.
Our Causes –
Planet, Humanity, Champion, Inclusion and Future
– shape, define and fuel Emerson’s culture while inspiring our innovative spirit and driving our focus.
Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or recently received your MBA degree, you’ll find opportunities with us. Join our team and start your journey today!
No calls or agencies please.

Title: Project Engineer - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Bidell Gas Compression
is a well-established natural gas compression manufacturing company located in South East Calgary.
We have an immediate opening for a full-time
Project Engineer.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Be a technical resource and mentor to the other Engineers, Project Managers and Project Designers in the department.
Take a leadership role in the development and improvement of new and current gas compression packages design and engineering.
Participate in the resolution of operational issues and challenges.
Work closely with the Scheduler to create and manage project schedule and deliverables for on time delivery.
Be a part of ongoing product and procedure improvements and innovations.
Create P&ID drawings for reciprocating and oil flooded screw compressor packages from 10 HP to 10,000 HP.
Collaborate with the Project Designer on 3D model generation and associated fabrication drawings.
Generate instrument B.O.M.’ s for process and utility systems.
Design and sizing calculations for process piping, pressure vessels, and equipment.
Supporting our product and company reputation through strict compliance of regulations.
Sizing and selection of all technical design components including: process piping design; pressure vessels; control systems and philosophy; heat exchangers; control valves and pressure relief valves.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Mechanical Engineering in combination with five to seven years of experience.
Recent and direct experience in gas compression packaging is required. Related Oil and Gas equipment packaging experience is an asset.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Strong working Knowledge of B31.3 and Section 8 Div. 1.
Technically driven. Strong attention to detail.
Capable of critical analysis and problem solving.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Proficient Word and Outlook skills.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and team building skills.
Results oriented with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Proven management and leadership experience, with demonstrated success through coaching, mentoring and engaging others to bring large scale projects to completion on time and on budget.
WHAT WE OFFER
Competitive compensation based on experience and education;
A strong value based organization;
An opportunity to be a part of a highly skilled team.
If you would like to join our team, please send your resume to:
Bidell Gas Compression

Title: Procurement Engineer/Specialist - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Brief
Terrestrial Energy is a developer of Generation IV advanced nuclear power plants that use its proprietary Integral Molten Salt Reactor (IMSR®) technology. IMSR® technology represents true innovation in cost reduction, versatility and functionality of nuclear power plants. IMSR® power plants will provide zero-carbon, reliable, dispatchable, cost-competitive electric power and high-grade industrial heat for use in many industrial applications, such as chemical synthesis and desalination, and in so doing extend the application of nuclear energy far beyond electric power markets. We have the potential to make important contributions to industrial competitiveness, energy security, and economic growth. Our deployment will support rapid global decarbonization of the primary energy system by displacing fossil fuel combustion across a broad spectrum. Using an innovative design, and proven and demonstrated molten salt reactor technology, we are engaged with regulators and industrial partners to complete IMSR® engineering and to commission first IMSR® power plants in the late 2020s. To execute this plan, we are now looking to add talented people to the team, each of whom will:
improve our team by adding diverse perspectives and innovative ways of problem solving
have demonstrated exceptional results in engineering projects
be a team player with the ability to collaborate closely and interact with other groups
be flexible and adaptable to change
have skillset and experience that relate to the following role:
Reports To
Head of Nuclear Supply Chain (NSC)
Location
Oakville, Ontario
Job Duties
The Procurement Engineer, under the direction of Head of NSC, is primarily responsible for the procurement of services and materials for specified spend categories required by various TEI departments. Other responsibilities include:
Process Purchase Requisitions (PRQ) in coordination with other TEI departments
Prepare and issue procurement documents including but not limited to PO’s and RFx (RFP’s, RFI’s, RFQ’s, etc.)
Implement and manage P2P (Procure To Pay)
Manage prequalification of suppliers and service providers in collaboration with QA
Evaluate supplier responses to TEI RFx and prepare comparative analysis using Balanced Scorecards
Negotiate with suppliers on lead-time, cost and quality so as to obtain the maximum benefit for TEI
Perform regular performance reviews of suppliers against TEI procurement requirements for cost, delivery performance, quality and services
Ensure commercial, legal, regulatory, contractual compliances in all procurement transactions.
Ensure compliance with TEI policies and procedures
Core Competencies
Communication
Negotiation
Decision Making
Planning and Organizing
Problem Solving
Results Orientation
Team player with the ability to collaborate and interact with other groups
Flexible and adaptable to change
Requirements
University degree in Engineering or equivalent
Supply Chain Management Professional SCMP certification or equivalent
Minimum 10 years of work experience in supply chain and procurement in nuclear energy, power generation or engineering industry.
Demonstrated success in supplier negotiations
Working knowledge of QA programs including ISO, CSA N standards
Experience of working in regulatory environments such as CNSC
Strong problem identification and problem resolution skills
Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills
Skilled at developing and maintaining strong relationships across all levels of the organization and with external customers and vendors
Assets
Working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Expert or working knowledge of ERP systems
Working knowledge of nuclear fuel market and industry e.g. U3O8, UO2, UF4, UF3, etc
Working knowledge of nuclear fuel supply chain including mining, conversion, enrichment, and fabrication
We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Terrestrial Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status.
If you require accommodation during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require technical support in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources at AODA@terrestrialenergy.com.

Title: Pump Engineer - Grimsby, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job
title: Pump Engineer
Job Location: Grimsby
ABOUT US
-
We are ERIKS, a technology driven, specialist industrial services provider offering a wide range of mechanical engineering solutions and technical services to an incredibly broad spectrum of industries. We are involved, often without you knowing, in your day to day lives from your breakfast in the morning, to t he microchips in your mobile and even supporting the NHS . We have over 7500 specialist colleagues in 20 countries adding ERIKS Value for industrial customers worldwide. Over the last 80 years, we continued to embed an entrepreneurial spirit and through our passion, specialism and innovation, we make industry work better.
ABOUT YOU -
Either apprentice-trained or time-served, you will be experienced in pump fitting and have good knowledge of an array of different types of pumps, from split case to end suction pumps with experience of working onsite at customers' premises as well as in a workshop environment
Your main
skill
s
will include:
Pump fitting skills
General mechanical fitting skills
Experience of working in workshop and customer onsite environments
Adherence to Health and Safety practices and procedures
ABOUT THE ROLE -
As Pump Engineer at ERIKS, you will carry out workshop activities for customers, including decommissioning, installing and repairing pumps for key customers, including workshop and onsite work.
ABOUT
OUR
OFFER -
In return for your passion and commitment, we offer trust, support and bespoke training to help ensure you continue to grow and thrive with us.
We empower all our employees to drive their own career and a development path and always look to grow our future leaders from within. Our internal Talent team will give you the tools you need to succeed in your career, and the ERIKS family will give you any support and guidance you may need to use them effectively.
On top of a competitive salary our benefits include:
25 days plus bank holidays annual holiday entitlement
Contributory Pension
Bike to Work Scheme
ABOUT OUR ENVIRONMENT -
At ERIKS we fully believe in the value of a diverse and inclusive workforce and are constantly challenging ourselves to create and nurture an environment that welcomes all , empowers our team to bring their whole self to work and perform at their best. We would welcome and encourage your application regardless of gender, race, religion, sexual orientation or whether you think differently and will do our level best to make the recruitment process an environment for you to show us the real you. If you need any special allowance or adjustments made throughout the process or want to understand more about what’s ahead, please don’t hesitate to get in touch with us at careers@eriks.co.uk
